website_summaries.verdict: Targeted skill-building through familiar, standards-based exercises.
pros: Pages feature engaging designs that are friendly and encouraging
Font is large and easy for kids to read
Wide variety of exercise types, including word and pictorial problems
cons: Some problems could be written better and have clearer directions

customer_reviews.title: Good workbook but can use a couple of improvements
customer_reviews.text: I am a CASA and bought this for an 8 year old boy I am mentoring. Overall, it's a good book. I like the format, different mix/type of problems, and large fonts. However, there are a couple of things that could be improved on: 1) Some assignments should be explained and given examples of how to do them. For example, when you ask students to "Round 7 to the nearest ten," there should be an explanation of what that means and how to do that. 2) Instructions for certain activities are just too long and wordy when they can be shorten and simplified.
customer_reviews.author: Living in SJ, CA

customer_reviews.title: Good Supplemental Practice
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent book to supplement the regular math book when a student needs extra math practice or just needs a break from boring drill. The variety of activities and puzzles put some ‘fun’ into math drill. (Authors were definitely creative!) The number of problems is not too many per page. This keeps it from discouraging the student. This series is terrific for summer review - to keep kids remembering g what they learned during the school year. (Buy the grade level they just finished.) I am a retired teacher, and I buy these for my grandchildren and they like them!
customer_reviews.author: K. Delaporte

customer_reviews.title: Errors, incorrect answers
customer_reviews.text: I just received this and also contacted Scholastic. The minute I opened i noticed an error on the cover not listing the correct answer as one of the choices. I personally don't have time to go through and double check the answers in reproducible, so will not be using this book. It seems like it would be great, but I'm nervous to use something with my students that could cause more confusion.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I likes these. I gave my daughter one test to do each week during the summer

customer_reviews.title: Grade-appropriate. Not enough examples or practice pgs
customer_reviews.text: Good for review, but it doesn’t have many examples, and practice pages are a bit limited as it’s only a 59 pg (plus answer pgs) book. Problems provided were useful for 3rd grade. Examples provided were just ok...
customer_reviews.author: janak23in

customer_reviews.title: Definitely works for my third grade granddaughter but some things ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely works for my third grade granddaughter but some things are more difficult than she has covered in school yet. Plan on sitting down to teach and not just busy work.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: good practice book
customer_reviews.text: It is a good combination book -- it has addition, subtraction, multiplication, division and basic fraction and decimal concepts. I considered this to be a good practice book for my 7 year old.
customer_reviews.author: theblackboa

customer_reviews.title: Too casual exercises, A little too much gamification
customer_reviews.text: This books takes a very lightweight approach to teaching match. That is good in a way. But, I have a feeling things have gone a bit too much. I would have liked a little more rigor.
customer_reviews.author: Looking Glass

customer_reviews.title: The material was a great review of concepts covered over my son's third grade ...
customer_reviews.text: The material was a great review of concepts covered over my son's third grade school year. It was an excellent tool to help prevent. summer slippage!
customer_reviews.author: MSpeller#24

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it for my 3rd grater she does a page everyday for homework lots of variety.
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: Keep my kids busy. There are not enough pages though. They finish everything by day 3. I still like though.
customer_reviews.author: emn

customer_reviews.title: Scholastic never disappoints!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sampling of math skills. Excellent test taking format. Scholastic never disappoints!
customer_reviews.author: C&P

customer_reviews.title: Too easy for 3rd grade
customer_reviews.text: My son is at 3rd grade, this workbook is more like for second grade.
customer_reviews.author: BZ

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: I love scholastic books. The books were very well packaged and shipping was a bit slow, but it was worth the wait. I am a homeschool teacher for my girls. And for my younger girls I needed these books for the summer to prepare them for their next grades. The books have great pages, good directions and easy to make lesson plans using these books.
customer_reviews.author: Pleased Couple

customer_reviews.title: Great book for kids to prep for 3rd grade
customer_reviews.text: Got this book for my son to prep for the 3rd grade.. it’s great
customer_reviews.author: Erica Panchal

customer_reviews.title: Amazing review
customer_reviews.text: Love this book. It has multiple tests which allows for much practice. Easy to read. Lightweight and answers in the back of the book.
customer_reviews.author: Deja

customer_reviews.title: Good review for summer work.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my almost 3rd graders to help keep them current during the summer (their school works a year ahead). Although I'm sure they'd rather do nothing, they seem to enjoy most of the activities in this workbook. My only complaint is that some of the pages don't have very clear directions and some have no directions at all. When I have to sit and think about it, it's probably not clear enough for 8 year olds. I do really like that it covers a wide variety of skills though. I'll buy the same thing next year for the next grade level.
customer_reviews.author: ShopGirl

customer_reviews.title: Good workbook
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to our homeschool curriculum. Seems to be on point for the grade level.
customer_reviews.author: BritishHistoryNut

customer_reviews.title: Great for extra learning
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for kids to put in an extra effort. Specially for weekends or summer learning.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Great Practice Workbook!
customer_reviews.text: This workbook has great practice materials in it to keep my child sharp, good for summer assignments or for additional work during the school year! Good quality, shipped quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Sprawls, Sr.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I have found so many wrong answers in this book. Do not buy. Your will get frustrated
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Order one grade higher
customer_reviews.text: These math problems are good examples of multiple-choice tests, but I found them too easy for my 3rd-grade students to use for realistic practice. I suggest ordering one grade up.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Knits

customer_reviews.title: Great Practice Workbook!
customer_reviews.text: This workbook has great practice materials in it to keep my child sharp, good for summer assignments or for additional work during the school year! Good quality, shipped quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Sprawls, Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Great for extra help!
customer_reviews.text: It was a great tool to give my kids a little extra practice and it helped improve their math grades.
customer_reviews.author: Charli Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Helped a lot to review and prepare for STARR tests especially in areas that she needed extra help in.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Dyess

customer_reviews.title: Good review for 3rd Grade
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these Scholastic math workbooks for my children to work on over the summer as a review of the grade they just completed. These are nice because they are not super thick therefore less intimidating for them to approach, especially during the summer. It has been a good way to keep math in their heads over the summer without being super difficult or too large of a workbook to complete in a few months. For the Scholastic workbooks, we prefer the Success with Workbooks over the ones that only contain tests as they have more "fun" elements instead of appearing as just "work".
customer_reviews.author: cadams

customer_reviews.title: Engaging workbook
customer_reviews.text: I love the fun activities that reinforce math concepts, and my students enjoy them, too!
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: some of the problems are not easy to
customer_reviews.text: OK, some of the problems are not easy to follow
customer_reviews.author: L Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: Good Material to keep your kids ahead. Bought it when my son was in regular public school, however he is now in a charter school and they keep him challenged enough so haven't had much chance to use these.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna

customer_reviews.title: Math Tests
customer_reviews.text: This book segments areas of math learning and then gives two possible assessments to take a closer look at what areas students aren't understanding.
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for everything I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for everything I wanted! It teaches the child the lesson, then gives them a worksheet to do. Love these books.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Books
customer_reviews.text: This is a great help for my grandson. He is going in the 3rd grade and this will help him
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These Books Improve My Nieces Math Grade An Entire Letter grade!!!
customer_reviews.author: gladys

customer_reviews.title: Standardized testing game plan
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent way to get your child ahead in the game of math!
customer_reviews.author: jehannenew

customer_reviews.title: good for summer
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy for my daughter who completed 3rd grade, good for summer review, somewhat easier than trying to find things online or intro from curriculum for next year. Nice piece of our summer math pie.
customer_reviews.author: A. Martz

product_meta.title: Scholastic Success with Math, Grade 3 (Scholastic Success with Workbooks: Math)
